{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3528577,"name":null,"username":"yeah","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/y/dbc845/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-02-16T08:20:32.513Z","cooked":"

Hi,
We are trying to combine MK4i L3(front) and MK4n L3(rear) for our swerve drive(all Krakens).
Since the gear ratio between mk4i (14t) and mk4n (16t) are different, we’re using WCP 16t Steel Spur Gear (20 DP, 8mm SplineXS Bore) on Krakens.
However we only have 8 of those and we’re also already using them on our other mechanisms.
We’re wondering what if we were to only change the drive motors on mk4i to 16t gear and the angle motors would stay 14t. What would happen is this situation or what could it cause in turning or spinning , would it cause it to spin out of control? Or be turning while drifting in a certain direction? Because there would be two angle motors turning slower than the other two.

Any help or suggestion is appreciated!
Thanks!

That is actually what 2910 did on their robot last year. It is fine, you just have to tune the modules in code for the different steering ratios.

Thanks for answering in such short time, but we’re currently using YAGSL for our swerve code, which only supports one kind of gear ratio. Is there any way we can change a part of the code to be able to enter two kinds of ratio? Or is it possible to modify the speed or the acceleration of the motors to make up for the difference?
This is our code.

It is discussed in the YAGSL thread here:

YAGSL 2025: A Leap Forward in Swerve Drive Control and Simulation! Programming
Good news! I didn’t break support for this! To do this you can override with a conversionFactors field in the module JSON in the new format.
